decoworld.model.world.combat

Interface HasHealth

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    HasCombat
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Arrow, CombatEntity, Crate, GenericMobSprite, Player

    public interface HasHealth
    Objects that have health should implement this interface. If you also need to damage or heal an object, implement HasCombat instead.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addHealthListener(HealthListener listener)
      Adds a health listener.
      double getHealth()
      Returns the percentage of remaining health, where a value of 1.0 represents getMaxHealth().
      double getMaxHealth()
      Returns the maximum health.
      boolean isDead()
      Returns true if the object is in a dead state (usually corresponding to when getHealth is equal to zero).
      void kill()
      Puts the object into a dead state.
      boolean removeHealthListener(HealthListener listener)
      Removes a health listener.
      void setHealth(double percentage)
      Sets the percentage of remaining health irrespective of any defense or healing bonuses.

    • Method Detail

      • getHealth

        double getHealth()
        Returns the percentage of remaining health, where a value of 1.0 represents getMaxHealth(). Percentages must always be greater than or equal to zero. To calculate the remaining health as a value: remainingHealth = getHealth() * getMaxHealth() Note: Percentages above 1.0 are valid and represent a temporary health boost above getMaxHealth()
        Returns:
        percentage - the percentage of remaining health

      • getMaxHealth

        double getMaxHealth()
        Returns the maximum health. Must be greater than 0. Note: It is possible to go over the maximum health when getHealth() returns a value greater than 1.0. This case represents a temporary health boost.
        Returns:
        maxHealth - the "maximum" health

      • setHealth

        void setHealth(double percentage)
        Sets the percentage of remaining health irrespective of any defense or healing bonuses. Sets the percentage of remaining health (see getHealth()) without taking defense or healing bonuses into account. Percentages must always be greater than or equal to zero. Do not use this method to damage or heal the object. Instead, implement the HasCombat interface and use a HealthEffect.
        Parameters:
        percentage - - the percentage of remaining health

      • isDead

        boolean isDead()
        Returns true if the object is in a dead state (usually corresponding to when getHealth is equal to zero). Otherwise returns false.
        Returns:
        - boolean

      • kill

        void kill()
        Puts the object into a dead state. See isDead()

      • addHealthListener

        void addHealthListener(HealthListener listener)
        Adds a health listener. See HealthEvent

      • removeHealthListener

        boolean removeHealthListener(HealthListener listener)
        Removes a health listener. See HealthEvent
